data.title: Spain's service PMI drops in January
data.description:
The HCOB Spain Services PMI Business Activity Index dropped from 57.3 in December to 54.9 in January, signaling a slower rate of expansion.

It still remained above the crucial 50.0 mark during January to signal a seventeenth successive monthly increase in service sector output.

Key findings include: jobs added in response to rising workloads and capacity pressures;new business growth fastest since April 2023; and input cost inflation sharpest in nearly a year.

“Last year's fourth quarter GDP figures once again surprised to the upside, driven by a robust labor market that bolsteredprivate consumption. Investments also picked up pace, likely spurred by the effects of the ECB's monetary policy easing.However, the latest HCOB composite Output PMI for Spain’s private sector economy suggests that growth has softenedsomewhat at the beginning of the year, as the upturn in both manufacturing and services moderated." said Jonas Feldhusen, Junior Economist at Hamburg Commercial Bank.

ETFs: (EWP), (EUFN)

data.title: TotalEnergies raises interim dividend by 7.6% to €0.85
data.description:
• TotalEnergies (NYSE:TTE) declares €0.85/share interim dividend, 7.6% increase from prior dividend of €0.79.
  • Payable July 1; for shareholders of record June 19; ex-div June 19.
  • Payable July 11 to ADS holders; record date June 18; ex-div June 18.
  • The company said that the distribution of a dividend of €3.22/share for fiscal year 2024, a 7% increase compared to the dividend for fiscal year 2023 of €3.01/share. This increase is comparable to the 7.1% increase for fiscal year 2023 versus 2022.
  • Furthermore, the board is considering a first interim dividend for 2025 (paid in the 4th quarter of 2025) at the level of the final dividend for fiscal year 2024.
  • See TTE Dividend Scorecard, Yield Chart, & Dividend Growth.

data.title: Toyota Motor reports nine-month results
data.description:
• Toyota Motor press release (NYSE:TM): GAAP PES of ¥307.95
  • Revenue of ¥35.67T (+4.8% Y/Y).
  • Operating income ¥3,679.4B (a decrease of ¥560.7B or 13.2% compared with FY2024 first nine months)
  • Income before income taxes ¥5,430B (an increase of ¥73B or 1.4% compared with FY2024 first nine months) Net income attributable to Toyota Motor Corporation ¥4,100.3B.
  • For FY 2025, the company expects: Sales revenues of ¥47T, Operating income of ¥4.7T, Income before income taxes of ¥6.18T and Net income of ¥4.52T.

data.title: Alfa Laval acquires UK-based NRG Marine
data.description:
• Alfa Laval (OTCPK:ALFVY) has signed an agreement to acquire NRG Marine, a UK-based supplier of ultrasonic antifouling solutions for industrial, marine and oil and gas applications, for an undisclosed sum.
  • The development to expand Alfa Laval's portfolio and meet increasing demand across industries by the increased use of innovative ultrasonic anti-fouling technology.
  • This acquisition aligns with future legislation and is considered more environmentally friendly, a growing concern for Alfa Laval's customer segments.
  • The acquisition is expected to close in the second quarter of this year.

data.title: TotalEnergies beats top-line and bottom-line estimates; initiates FY25 outlook
data.description:
• TotalEnergies press release (NYSE:TTE): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $1.90 beats by $0.09.
  • Revenue of $47.12B (-14.0% Y/Y) beats by $4.35B.
  • Sales of petroleum products in the fourth quarter 2024 were down 5% quarter-to-quarter, mainly due to seasonality of European fuel demand.
  • 2024 dividend increase of 7% - $8 billion buybacks in 20248.3% gearing at year-end 2024.
  • In the Oil & Gas business, fourth quarter production was 2.43 Mboe/d.
  • Hydrocarbon production was 2,434 thousand barrels of oil equivalent per day in 2024, up 2% year-on-year (excluding the Canada disposal representing 3.5%). Hydrocarbon production for LNG in the fourth quarter was up 6% quarter-to-quarter.
  • Net power production was 11.4 TWh in the fourth quarter 2024, up 2% on the quarter due to the seasonal increase in power production from flexible capacities in Europe.
  • "Furthermore, the Board of Directors confirmed a shareholder return policy for 2025 targeting >40% CFFO payout, which will combine interim dividends increasing by 7.6% to €0.85/share and $2 billion of share buybacks per quarter, a level which will be pursued under reasonable market conditions."
  • Outlook: In 2025, TotalEnergies anticipates its hydrocarbon production will grow more than 3%, benefiting from the ramp-up of 2024 start-ups and production start-ups, notably Ballymore in the Gulf of Mexico and Mero-4 in Brazil.
  • First quarter 2025 hydrocarbon production is expected to be between 2.5 and 2.55 Mboe/d.
  • The Integrated Power segment is expected to expand in 2025 supported by electricity production growth greater than 20% to reach an annual net electricity generation of more than 50 TWh.
  • Cash flow before working capital is expected to be between $2.5 and $3 billion in 2025.
  • By combining hydrocarbon and electricity production growth, the Company expects to increase energy production by 5% in 2025. Integrated Power production will represent 10% of hydrocarbon production.
  • For 2025, TotalEnergies expects net investments of $17 to $17.5 billion, of which $4.5 billion is dedicated to low carbon energies, mostly Integrated Power.

  • Organic investments should amount to approximately $17 billion, focused on core growth projects to achieve 2030 production targets, down from the $18 billion guidance presented during the Strategy & Outlook in October 2024.

data.title: K&F Growth Acquisition prices $250M IPO at $10 per share
data.description:
• K&F Growth Acquisition (KFIIU) priced its initial public offering of 25M units at a price of $10.00 per unit.
  • The units are expected to be listed on the Nasdaq and begin trading tomorrow, February 5, 2025, under the ticker symbol “KFIIU.”
  • Each unit consists of one Class A ordinary share and one right to receive one fifteenth of one Class A ordinary share.
  • There are no warrants issued publicly or privately in connection with this offering.
  • Once the securities constituting the units begin separate trading, the Class A ordinary shares and Share Rights are expected to be listed on Nasdaq under the symbols “KFII” and “KFIIR,” respectively.
  • The offering is expected to close on February 6, 2025.
  • Underwriters have a 45-day option to purchase up to an additional 3.75M units.

data.title: Veralto beats Q4 top-line and bottom-line estimates; initiates Q1 and FY25 outlook
data.description:
• Veralto press release (NYSE:VLTO): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.95 beats by $0.08.
  • Revenue of $1.35B (+4.7% Y/Y) beats by $50M, with non-GAAP core sales growth of 4.6%.
  • Operating cash flow was $285 million and non-GAAP free cash flow was $263 million.

  • 2025 Guidance: The company provides forecasted sales only on a non-GAAP basis because of the difficulty in estimating the other components of GAAP sales, such as currency translation, acquisitions, and divestitures.

  • For the first quarter of 2025, Veralto anticipates that non-GAAP core sales will grow low-to-mid-single digits year-over-year with adjusted operating profit margin between 24.0% and 24.5% and adjusted diluted earnings per share in the range of $0.84 to $0.88 per share (consensus of $0.87).

  • For the full year 2025, the company anticipates that non-GAAP core sales will grow low-to-mid-single digits year-over-year and that adjusted operating profit margin will expand 25 to 50 basis points year-over-year. The company is targeting adjusted diluted earnings per share in the range of $3.60 to $3.70 (consensus of $3.72) with free cash flow conversion in the range of 90% to 100% of GAAP net earnings.

data.title: China's Huachen AI Parking Management Technology prices IPO at $4 per share
Alfa Laval AB GAAP EPS of SEK 4.96, revenue of SEK 18.31B; issues Q1 soft outlook
data.description:
• Alfa Laval AB (publ) press release (OTCPK:ALFVY): Q4 GAAP EPS of SEK 4.96.
  • Revenue of SEK 18.31B (+2.6% Y/Y).
  • Order intake increased by 8% to SEK 18,476 million.
  • Adjusted EBITA SEK 2,922 million; Adjusted EBITA margin 16.0%.
  • Cash flow from operating activities: SEK 4,032 million.

  • Outlook for the first quarter: "We expect demand in the first quarter to be on about the same level as in the fourth quarter."

data.title: Husqvarna AB Non-GAAP EPS of -SEK 1.15, revenue of SEK 8.46B
data.description:
• Husqvarna AB press release (OTCPK:HUSQF): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of -SEK 1.15.
  • Revenue of SEK 8.46B (-1.7% Y/Y). Sales declined organically by 3%.
  • Cash flow from operations and investments amounted to SEK -925m. Direct operating cash flow increased to SEK 582m.
